meanings.definition: To show displeasure or disappointment by pushing out the lips.
meanings.sent1: She pouted when she didn't get the toy she wanted.
meanings.sent2: The child pouted after being told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent3: The puppy pouted when its favorite toy rolled under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds pouted, ready to burst with rain.
meanings.sent5: Her pouting face made it clear she was upset.

meanings.definition: To protrude or stick out in a sulky or sullen manner.
meanings.sent1: He pouted his lower lip in a show of defiance.
meanings.sent2: The cat pouted as it was carried away from the sunny spot.
meanings.sent3: The balloon pouted as the air slowly leaked out.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak pouted against the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The flower pouted, wilting in the heat of the sun.
